Description: An autonomous AI software developer (formerly OpenDevin) capable of executing complex tasks using MCP tools.
An agentic coding tool by Anthropic that runs in the terminal capable of using MCP tools to manipulate codebases.
A collection of MCP servers for AWS services including ECS EKS and Serverless infrastructure.
An MCP server for interacting with Azure AI Foundry projects and models (Note: functionality moving to cloud).
An MCP server that enables AI assistants to control a web browser for automation tasks.
An open-source AI code assistant for VS Code and JetBrains that connects to MCP servers for context.
The AI-powered code editor that provides native support for connecting to MCP servers to enhance coding context.
An AI chat client designed specifically to implement and demonstrate the Model Context Protocol.
An MCP server designed to add task management and project planning capabilities to AI editors.
The Firebase CLI which includes an MCP server mode to help AI agents manage Firebase projects.
An open-source implementation of the Manus agent concept capable of using MCP tools for various tasks.
An MCP integration that allows Cursor AI to read designs from and make modifications to Figma files.
An MCP server that provides AI agents with access to Grafana dashboards metrics and logs.
An MCP server that allows AI agents to interact directly with the context and state of JetBrains IDEs.
A platform and SDK designed to help AI agents use tools reliably at scale via MCP.
A composable framework for building effective agents using MCP and simple workflow patterns.
An open-source extensible AI chat platform that supports plugins and MCP to connect LLMs with external tools.
A VS Code/Cursor plugin that acts as a client/debugger for testing MCP servers during development.
An MCP server that exposes your Obsidian vault's notes and search capabilities to AI agents.
A multi-agent framework that enables the creation of cooperating agents which can utilize MCP tools.
An MCP server for interacting with Azure DevOps resources like Work Items Repos and Pull Requests.
An AI virtual database that integrates various data sources and exposes them to agents via MCP.
A framework for developing LLM agents with built-in support for function calling and MCP integration.
Vite plugin that enables a MCP server helping models to understand your Vue app better
Witsy: desktop AI assistant / universal MCP client
A web-based MCP client playground designed to test and interact with MCP servers.
A generic testing and evaluation client for MCP servers and agents.
An embeddable AI chat component and agent platform that unifies multiple LLMs.
A voice-first, multimodal client interface
An official MCP server from Notion that exposes the Notion API as standardized tools, enabling MCP-based agents to read and manage Notion workspace content.

A runnable MCP-based system where the MCP server is distributed as part of the Trigger.dev application/tooling (invoked via the Trigger.dev CLI), exposing operational project-management and run-control tools to MCP Hosts.
